cause.description:
In a country where 70% of the population lives under the poverty line, and over 80% rely on subsistence farming and cattle raising, crushing poverty and crippling debt continue to undermine the ability of rural families to fend for themselves.
This project will provide food assistance to the most vulnerable members of the population, mainly children suffering from severe malnutrition, and help restore the government’s and families’ abilities to cope with environmental and market shocks.
1. Niger’s biggest problem is poverty; a focus on survival strategies is essential
cause.mission: combat child malnutrition, assist the poor to rebuild their livelihoods and strengthen peoples’ and government’s ability to respond to hunger crises.
cause.name: Fight child hunger in Niger
